title: FOG problem - Quotes don't work
content:
Hi guys,   
   
I have a problem with Fontographer. My quotesingle and quotedbl don't work in Quark. They work in FOG, but when I generate the font, they don't work.   
The fill colour is OK and the font is generated as a macintosh postscript 1 with a NFNT bitmap output.   
   
Has anyone else had this problem before?   
   
Thanks in advance,

 [‹ Unicode and TypeTool/FontLab.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007051816/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3998 "Go to previous forum topic") [Romanian T comma Vs. T cedilla ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007051816/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3970 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Characters

comments.content: Sounds like you have "smart quotes" checked in the Quark preferences, which causes the "stupid" quotesingle and quotedbl to be replaced by the curly quote marks. If you have no glyph in these character positions, it will seem as if the "stupid" quote marks aren't working.

Yep, that's it. I should have known. I work with Kwark now for 10 year... it's time we go over to InDesign.   
   
Thanks Nick,

Well, much as I love InDesign, this particular problem could happen in InDesign just as easily as QuarkXPress. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007051816im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
Cheers,
